edge: Farrokh replaces Tim Staffell as lead singer of Smile, which becomes Queen.
John Deacon joins Queen as their new bassist.
Farrokh changes his name to Freddie Mercury and renames the band Queen.
John Reid books an American tour for Queen.
Paul Prenter manages the daily schedule of Freddie Mercury.
Queen places extensive effort into recording 'Bohemian Rhapsody' for their fourth studio album, A Night at the Opera.
Executive Ray leaves Queen when they quit EMI.
executive Ray Foster refuses to release 'Bohemian Rapsody' as the lead single from EMI
Freddie conspires with radio DJ Kenny Everett to debut 'Bohemian Rhapsody' on his programme
despite critical pans, 'Bohemian Rhapsody' becomes a global hit
tensions arise over Paul's influence on Freddie
Freddie died in 1991 from AIDS-related pneumonia at the age of 45.
The Mercury Phoenix Trust was established by Freddie's band Queen and his friend Jim Hutton in 1992 to raise funds for AIDS research.
Freddie remained friends with Mary until his death in 1991.
Freddie had a loving relationship with Jim Hutton during the final years of his life.
